snippet: Improving its ability to find treasure amid junk offers Facebook a chance to topple Google from the throne as the king of search.
abstract: Analysts say Facebook, which has had stock rally over increased advertising efforts, needs to improve its search ability to challenge Google; it has expanded its search engineer staff and rolled out new features to help users discover information on site.

headline.main: Fortunes of Facebook May Hinge on Searches
headline.print_headline: Fortunes Of Facebook May Hinge On Searches

snippet: Analysts say Apple must decide whether to keep catering to the high end of the market or offer something cheaper.
abstract: Analysts say Apple must decide whether to keep catering to high end of the phone market with its iPhone, reaping fat profits from relatively fewer sales, or offer something cheaper to compete with lower-cost alternatives like Samsung's phones; stock price is down 30 percent since Sept 2012.

headline.main: Worry Over Sales Spurs Talk of Cheaper iPhones
headline.print_headline: Worry Over Sales Spurs Talk of Cheaper iPhones

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Monday, selections include Uber opening for business in Washington, Chinese electronics companies making a big push for acceptance in th...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Monday, selections include Uber opening for business in Washington, Chinese electronics companies making a big push for acceptance in the West and why some in Japan love an old-fashioned flip phone.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Bookless Libraries and Anti-Drone Clothing

snippet: Even after Oracle fixed a serious security flaw in its Java software on Sunday, the Department of Homeland Security said Monday that the fix was not sufficient and urged users to disable the software on their Web browsers.
abstract: Even after Oracle fixed a serious security flaw in its Java software on Sunday, the Department of Homeland Security said Monday that the fix was not sufficient and urged users to disable the software on their Web browsers.

headline.main: Department of Homeland Security: Disable Java 'Unless It Is Absolutely Necessary'

snippet: As more Americans take up yoga, hotel companies, and even some airports, are beginning to cater to avid practitioners.
abstract: Hotel companies, and even some airports, are beginning to cater to avid yoga practitioners; number of Americans practicing yoga has risen 29 percent to 20.4 million since 2008.

headline.main: A Moment of Zen, on the Go
headline.print_headline: A Moment of Zen, on the Go

snippet: Appleâ€™s stock dropped after reports emerged that the company had cut orders for parts for the iPhone 5 because of weak demand.
abstract: Stocks fall as worries over demand for Apple products drives down its shares and investors brace for earnings disappointments.

headline.main: Concerns About Apple Weigh on S.&P. and Nasdaq
headline.print_headline: Concerns About Apple Weigh on S.&P. and Nasdaq

snippet: For many people, smartphone shopping comes down to a choice of Apple's iPhone or one powered by Google's Android software. But now consumers can get an iPhone and fill it with Google, as Nick Wingfield and Claire Cain Miller report on Monday in Th...
abstract: For many people, smartphone shopping comes down to a choice of Apple's iPhone or one powered by Google's Android software. But now consumers can get an iPhone and fill it with Google, as Nick Wingfield and Claire Cain Miller report on Monday in The New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Google Invades the iPhone

snippet: If you need help with your new app, see if the program has a built-in help guide or check the developer's Web site for technical support.
abstract: If you need help with your new app, see if the program has a built-in help guide or check the developer's Web site for technical support.

snippet: Account assignments, executive appointments and miscellaneous news from advertising agencies.
Google has become one of the most prolific developers of apps for the Apple iPhone, helping its rival even as their relationship worsens.
abstract: Google has become one of the most prolific developers of apps for the Apple iPhone, helping its rival even as their relationship worsens; strategy is aimed at accessing as much user data as possible, while gaining user loyalty and replacing proprietary Apple software.

headline.main: Google Gains From Creating Apps for the Opposition
headline.print_headline: A Stealth Tactic In the Mobile Wars

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
